content.description: This route is long with a distinct crux.  Despite its broken appearance the climbing is fun even when it gets easier.  The long length and feeling of exposure as you move through the steep sections make this one a real treat.
content.location: This climb is the second one right of the waterfall and climbs the main strength of the wall.

content.description: Hard start to moderate middle section and a steep fun finish.  There is a section of 5.2 climbing where a mistake will have you hitting the dirt.  So, pay attention and don't fall off, it is really easy but pay attention.
content.location: Start by reaching up positive slanted ledge that is smaller at the lower end.

content.description: Hard start to easier climbing and a steep juggy finish.  There is a section of 5.4 climbing where a mistake will have you hitting the dirt.  So, pay attention and don't fall off, it is really easy but pay attention.
content.location: Right side of the wall.  First move is up and left to a foot rail.

content.description: This route is sustained for the first 40 feet then eases up but stays fun.  Clipping the anchors will get your attention if you are short or mentally fried by the time you get to them as you are a bit above your last bolt.  Move left a little and you will feel better making the clip.
content.location: First route right of the waterfall.

content.description: This is the left finish to Brownie Redpoints and is a little easier but more sustained at the grade.
content.location: Third route from the left a bolt or two protect moves to a good ledge.  After the flake around the fourth bolt continue straight up rather than moving slightly right which is Brownie Redpoints.

content.description: Start is thin and the middle is easy but the final headwall will make you smile.   There is a section of 5.2 climbing where a mistake will have you hitting the dirt.  So, pay attention and don't fall off, it is really easy but pay attention.
content.location: Farthest right route about 15 feet from a low angle left facing corner.

content.description: Long route that is not too sustained but the climbing is still fun and the finish will get your attention.
content.location: Third route right of the waterfall which was still running today.  12/5/12

content.description:
This is a small crag with long routes so bring a 70M rope.  It is east southeast facing and gets a lot of sun until later in the day.  Depending on the time of year the cliff has a waterfall/water streak running down it that has patches of beautiful green moss hanging from it.  At the bottom of the waterfall is a small to large 10X10 pool and a lot of green grass.  During the Monsoon sections may be unclimbable due to the waterfalls output. 

  The cliff itself is 115 feet tall and despite a broken appearance the climbing remains fun even when the difficulties ease.  The rock is pretty unusual for Mount Lemmon with a coarse sandpaper like texture at the bottom and smoother holds higher up.  There are a lot of in cut edges which keeps the climbing relatively easy and fun even when it looks like it will get hard.
